fast3d.renderables

Class Triangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.renderables.Triangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdvTriangle

    public class Triangle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable
    a simple, not illuminated (but with constant color) triangle in space
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Triangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c)
      constructs a triangle with the given edges and the color white
      Triangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Color color)
      constructs a triangle with the given edges

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3d calculatePunctureWithLine(Vector3d lineOrig, Vector3d lineDir)
      calculates the point that is on both this and the given line
      the lines length is the length of its direction-vector
      the given ray is mathematically restricted with the length-coefficient of the direction-vector in the interval [0.0d,1.0d]
      Triangle clone() 
      boolean collides(Triangle t)
      two triangles collide if they are not the same one and one side of the parameter triangle has a puncture point with this
      boolean contains(Vector3d v) 
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      Color getColor()

      Vector3d getEdge2() 
      Vector3d getEdge3()

      Plate getPlate() 
      Vector3d getPos()
      should not return null
      should return a reference (should not must)
      Vector3d getSide12() 
      Vector3d getSide13() 
      Vector3d getSide23() 
      Vector3d[] getVertices()
      should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
      a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
      may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
      boolean hasEqualEdges(Triangle t) 
      void lookInDirection(Vector3d dir)
      aligns the direction as new normal
      lookInDirection calculates a rotation, the rotation-axis will be the crossProduct of currentNormal and newNormal (== given direction)
      void moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
      multiple triangles can be combined to an object, but share their edges so that on movement of the entire object every edge only has to be moved once
      void moveTo(Vector3d target)
      moves the triangle so that it's center will be at the target but holds it orientation
      Vector3d rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig, Vector3d rayDir)
      for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
      may return null
      void render(Graphics3d g)
      called when this renderables is requested to draw itself on screen on the way prior calculated by shade()
      void rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      rotates the triangle around the given axis
      should not rotate with an angle of 0d
      void rotX(double rad)
      rotates the line around the constant x axis
      void rotY(double rad)
      rotates the line around the constant y axis
      void rotZ(double rad)
      rotates the line around the constant z axis
      void shade(Graphics3d s)
      called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
      the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
      during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
      java.lang.String toString()

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if the given triangle has the same color and same edges which can be flipped (edge1 may be edge2 and vice versa)

      • hasEqualEdges

        public boolean hasEqualEdges(Triangle t)
        Parameters:
        t - the triangle to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the other triangle has the same edges, no matter in which order (edge 1,2,3)

      • shade

        public void shade(Graphics3d s)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
        the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
        during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
        Specified by:
        shade in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        s - the 3d-graphics-context to do calculations, not null

      • render

        public void render(Graphics3d g)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        called when this renderables is requested to draw itself on screen on the way prior calculated by shade()
        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        g - the 3d-graphics-context to do drawings, not null

      • rayTrace

        public Vector3d rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig,
                         Vector3d rayDir)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
        may return null
        Specified by:
        rayTrace in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        rayOrig - the start-point of the ray
        rayDir - the direction-vector of the ray
        Returns:
        the puncture-point with the ray

      • calculatePunctureWithLine

        public Vector3d calculatePunctureWithLine(Vector3d lineOrig,
                                          Vector3d lineDir)
        calculates the point that is on both this and the given line
        the lines length is the length of its direction-vector
        the given ray is mathematically restricted with the length-coefficient of the direction-vector in the interval [0.0d,1.0d]
        Parameters:
        lineOrig - the start-point of the ray to puncture this
        lineDir - the direction of the ray to puncture this
        Returns:
        the puncture-point of the ray to this, null if the ray does not puncture this

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Vector3d v)
        Parameters:
        v - the point to test
        Returns:
        whether the point is within this triangle

      • rotX

        public void rotX(double rad)
        rotates the line around the constant x axis
        Parameters:
        rad - the angle to rotate mathematically positive in radiant

      • rotY

        public void rotY(double rad)
        rotates the line around the constant y axis
        Parameters:
        rad - the angle to rotate mathematically positive in radiant

      • rotZ

        public void rotZ(double rad)
        rotates the line around the constant z axis
        Parameters:
        rad - the angle to rotate mathematically positive in radiant

      • rot

        public void rot(Vector3d axis,
                double rad)
        rotates the triangle around the given axis
        should not rotate with an angle of 0d
        Parameters:
        axis - the axe to rotate around in mathematically positive direction
        rad - the angle to rotate mathematically positive in radiant

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(Vector3d target)
        moves the triangle so that it's center will be at the target but holds it orientation
        Parameters:
        target - the new triangle's center

      • lookInDirection

        public void lookInDirection(Vector3d dir)
        aligns the direction as new normal
        lookInDirection calculates a rotation, the rotation-axis will be the crossProduct of currentNormal and newNormal (== given direction)
        Parameters:
        dir - the new triangles normal-vector

      • moveInAbsoluteDirection

        public void moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
        multiple triangles can be combined to an object, but share their edges so that on movement of the entire object every edge only has to be moved once
        Parameters:
        dir - the movements delta-vector

      • collides

        public boolean collides(Triangle t)
        two triangles collide if they are not the same one and one side of the parameter triangle has a puncture point with this
        Parameters:
        t - the triangle to check collision with
        Returns:
        true if any side of the parameter has a puncture-point with this

      • getVertices

        public Vector3d[] getVertices()
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
        a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
        may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
        Specified by:
        getVertices in interface Renderable
        Returns:
        the three triangle-edges

      • getNormal

        public Vector3d getNormal()
        Returns:
        a clone vector that is orthogonal to the plate

      • getPos

        public Vector3d getPos()
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        should not return null
        should return a reference (should not must)
        Specified by:
        getPos in interface Renderable
        Returns:
        a clone to the triangles center

      • getPlate

        public Plate getPlate()
        Returns:
        an independent plate object containing this
